text: Dark clouds passing overhead. The bad weather that has hovered over the Eifel mountains Germany), the past three days is on it's way out..
A pupil dilates and contracts in the light. The eye stare Blinks. Thinks. Making evaluations..
The first rays of sunshine break through. The voices of international TV commentators in different languages.
...in places the track is still dangerously wet, but following a drivers meeting the decision has been taken. The race is going ahead...

The eye belongs to a 27 year old Formula 1 RACING DRIVER wearing a fireproof balaclava... Highly intelligent, he also happens to be World Champion. name is painted on the side of his Ferrari. NIKI LAUDA.

My grandfather always said history is cruel and reductive and no matter how long we live, or how much we achieve - we are remembered for very little. So make sure it's the right things. NIKI stares up at the clouds. His eyelids flicker. Thinki Agonizing. Wrestling with an all important decision... Is it going to carry on raining? Or become dry? Should he using slicks or wets?
We widen to find ourselves on the starting grid of a majo Grand Prix. All around us...
Engines scream into life as DRIVERS start their cars. An OFFICIAL walks through the cars holding aloft a sign, "On Minute"... Deafening, angry thunder as engines rev impatiently.
This is bullshit. We have no control over our legacy. We cannot choose what we are remembered for... A Ferrari MECHANIC rushes towards NIKI, and shouts in Ita above the noise, (we see sub-titles)...
Mass usa slicks. Le vuoi cambiare anche tu? (Mass is going on slicks. You want to change?)
NIKI looks in his wing-mirror back to see a red McLaren, helmet, number 12, several rows behind him. A team of MECHANICS hastily changing the tyres to dry tyres.

Otherwise I wouldn't be remembered for my rivalry with this asshole. And the 1976 season. NIKI then looks over at the car in pole position beside h Another McLaren, but with number 11, and a Union Jack...
What about Hunt? Has he changed?

No, he's going on wets. The car in pole position: JAMES HUNT, surrounded by TV cr mechanics, girlfriends, hangers-on.. The Maclaren team is less than half the size of Ferrari's HUNT makes up for this with magnetism. The rock star of F NIKI's face: a stab of envy seeing a flash of his rival's glamorous long blonde hair disappearing into his balaclav flirting with several hot-looking GIRLS..
I don't know why it became such a big thing. We were just drivers. Busting each other's balls. To me this is perfectly normal. But other people saw it differently.
NIKI (contid)
That whatever it was between us went deeper. And changed us both somehow. Forever. NIKI stares, then... NIKI
Be, allora usiamo anche noi quells da bagnato. (Then we go on wets, too.)

The ten-second board is held up. NIKI pulls down his visor...as he and HUNT's eyes meet fo split-second, eyes staring... NIKI selects second gear for the wet track and revs the engine. The dashboard needle climbs through 8000, 9000, 1 RPM. NIKI
Maybe that explains the state of mind I was in. And why it happened. The other thing I'm remembered for. (a beat)

On August 1st, that same year... CAPTION: "AUGUST 1st, 1976". The STARTER waves the flag. NIKI's foot hits the floor - engine screams that deafening, stomach rearranging high-p scream, drowning out the roar of the 180,000 crowd. NIKI's car is catapaulted forward violently, the wheel-sp leaving livid black scars on the asphalt.. NIKI gets away first. A good start! But within seconds th a McLaren car right behind him, breathing down his neck. His arch-rival. HUNT. But as the McLaren roars past, NIKI sees a white helmet. Number 12. It's not Hunt. It's MASS. On his bald, slick t NIKI curses under his breath. He screwed up. Made the wro decision. Should have gone on slicks. He urgently needs t change tyres... NIKI swerves angrily into the pits. Ferrari's pit is righ one end...

Commentary from all the world's TV stations explaining th crazy, panicked situation as all the DRIVERS come into th pits to change to dry tyres. It's chaos. A traffic jam of Formula 1 cars... The Ferrari team frantically work. Changing NIKI's tyres. men with air guns, two men with rapid-duty jacks. The sam Italian MECHANIC appears, `plugs in' his headset to the c MECHANIC
Hair visto? Ti aveto detto di usare le slicks! (See? I told you to go on slicks!!) NIKI
Bullshit. Where's Hunt?
There! NIKI looks up to see the name JAMES HUNT written on the b helmet roar out of the pits ahead, with new tyres on...
C'mon...!! NIKI screams at the MECHANICS, who are struggling. The ai make a high-pitched noise...something's not right. NIKI
What's GOING ON??? "Thump", new (slick) tyres hit the tarmac, engines scream NIKI exit the pits in pursuit of HUNT. But the delay has him dear...
Archive TV commentary from the world's race COMMENTATORS stations informs us of the positions. MASS leading, HUNT in 3rd, LAUDA in 20th...
NIKI gives it everything he's got. Tearing through the ge trying to catch JAMES HUNT, breaking as late as he can, e screaming.

He flies over the take-off hump between Pflanzgarten and Swallowtail - passes one car after another. Into 13th pla now. Pulling off outrageous manoeuvres. NIKI's P.O.V: the world flies past in a blur. The steerin wheel shakes. The car is right on the edge. Cannot be dri any harder. NIKI approaches the Streckenteil Adenauer-Brucke section the course...turns left at the Bergwerk corner. Crazy spe And tight. Too tight. A mistake... "Thump", his wheels come into contact with the kerb on th inside. NIKI tries to counter-steer, but is travelling at mph. The car jerks horribly to the right.. "Crunch", hits the embankment, then "Bang", hits the barr and is thrown across the track.. Fire breaks out in the engine. NIKI's eyes widen in horro with another car bearing down upon him...

No...! The oncoming car crashes head-on into our car, "Crash", a sickening, terrifying impact. The car explodes. Seventy litres of burning high-octane gasoline, with NIKI strapped inside, unable to undo his seatbelt. Locked in a blast furnace. NIKI screams as the flames engulf him. 800 degrees temperature. Trapped inside his car. Burning smoke fills his helmet, scarring his lungs... Pandemonium: commentary in different languages as panicke commentators helplessly describe what's happening.. NIKI's POV: he can just make out the barely recognizable figures of the other DRIVERS rushing towards NIKI.. Their hands get burnt in the flames as they try unsuccess to undo NIKI's seatbelt.. Fire extinguishers blast at the car. Dry powder extinguis Covering NIKI's helmet. Blurring his vision, as he cries in agony, inhaling the powder.. Screaming voices. Panicked reactions. On the side of the the painted name `Niki Lauda' blisters and melts.
Then sound fades. As NIKI blacks out - losing consciousne
Over this: the sound of a ringing phone...

We're in a busy hospital A&E unit. Noise. Crowds. A regul Saturday late afternoon. The phone continues to ring.. Finally, an attractive station NURSE in her 20's, run-off feet, breathlessly picks up the phone. NURSE
Emergency... She covers her ears, straining to hear, listening to what being said. Then her expression changes... NURSE
Okay...standing by! The NURSE hangs up...then calls out to her NURSE and DOCT colleagues... NURSE

That was the race-track..! There's been an accident..! A driver's been injured and is on his way in..! Instantly the atmosphere changes. A hive of activity as DOCTORS and NURSES prepare themselves for a major trauma. All PATIENTS with minor injuries are cleared out of the w The NURSE rings upstairs to the operating theatres and consultant surgeons, telling them to stand by...

Swing doors open, and a pair of shoeless, BARE FEET walks through and into the accident and emergency unit. Camera tilts up a pair of long legs in white racing overalls...to reveal a tall, good-looking driver, JAMES H (mid 20's), tanned, athletic, surfer long blonde hair... A man about whom a word comes to mind one would rarely us describe an Englishman. SEXY. Blood trickles from his nose, there is bruising to his li the formation (already) of a nasty black eye, but make no mistake. He rocks. Drop-dead gorgeous..
I think the racetrack telephoned ahead that I was coming? Hunt? James Hunt..?
JAMES notices all the NURSES staring..
What's the matter? No one seen a spot of blood before?
Are you all right?
Absolutely fine.
The attractive NURSE is examining JAMES, opening his over checking for wounds, cuts and bruises...
We all thought you'd been in an accident.
I have. If you call a friendly disagreement with another driver an accident.
What did you disagree about?
None of your business. Ouch.
Sorry.
His wife.
That's going to need a couple of stitches. It's a nasty cut.
It was a nasty blow. Done with a bloody spanner.
Why? What did you do?
Nothing! Only what she begged me to do.
The NURSE notices bruising on JAMES's chest...
Which was..?
She examines him, testing his ribs for fractures, his che JAMES looks up. Their eyes meet..
Be happy to show you if you like.

`Crash', the door flies open as JAMES and the NURSE stumb through, mid-embrace, tearing at one another's clothes... The apartment is basic. Cramped. Messy. Like that of a po student. Ashtrays filled with half-smoked joints. Empty b cans. A toaster. A kettle. A stereo. A cage containing tw budgerigars. A mattress on the floor. Newspapers with headlines about the Dockers Strike, Engla crumbling economy, Rolls Royce being bailed out by the government - subtle reminders of Britain in transition, leaving behind its strong, imperial past. JAMES and the NURSE stand against the wall, still half- dressed, but already passionately making love...

I have a theory why women like racing drivers. It's not because they respect what we do...driving round and round in circles. Mostly they think that's pathetic. And they're probably right.. (a beat) It's our closeness to death.
JAMES and the NURSE continue noisily, tirelessly making l in the shower...
The closer you are to death, the more alive you FEEL...the more alive you ARE. And they can see that in you. FEEL that in you. The way you live. Willing to risk everything.

JAMES (V/O) (contid) With no thought for tomorrow...as if each day is your last. It's a wonderful way to live...and the ONLY way to drive. The only way to get that tenth of a second on everyone else...
The lovemaking becomes more intense...
To dare to be one step bolder...one step faster...
JAMES is covered in perspiration, out on the edge...
Sure one step closer to death...
JAMES and the NURSE, both screaming as they approach orga
But one step closer to victory, too...
JAMES and the NURSE both climax together...and collapse o bed. Exhausted.
A grotty old race track in South London. JAMES and the NURSE arrive at Crystal Palace race track i battered old mini. They get out. She looks up, seeing the mechanics, the racing teams, the cars..
I've never been to a Grand Prix before.
You still haven't. This is Formula 3.
What's that?
A lower division. Where people like me mess about in the hope of finding sponsors or being talent-spotted to race in Formula 1.
JAMES leads the NURSE into...
The pits where JAMES introduces her to his team...
Everyone, this is Nursie.
(correcting)
Gemma...
Nursie, this is Doc our designer...
How do you do?
Bubbles, our chief mechanic.
How do you do?
Le Patron - Alexander, Lord Hesketh.
How do you do?
Fine, thanks. Blimey...is everyone in Formula 3 this posh?
Glass of champagne, Nursie?
It's Gemma. No, thanks.
You sure? It's Krug. Clos de Mesnil.
It's also ten in the morning.
Oh, dear. Superstar? You haven't brought us a bore, have you? JAMES strips off, changing into his racing overalls.
Trust me. Nursie's anything BUT a bore..
The NURSE, meanwhile, drifts over to look at the car wher BUBBLES is making last minute checks...
That's the car?
That's her. The Dastle Mk 9...with the Lotus twin-cam sixteen hundred engine. She's no beauty. But goes like the clappers.
An odd-looking car. A bit like a giant Go-kart, blue with yellow strips along the side and James's name in small letters. It looks small, dangerously fragile.
Uuuurrrrrkkkkkkggghghhhh.
The NURSE is shocked to hear a dreadful watery vomiting s She sees JAMES bent over behind the truck...
Nothing to be worried about! Does it before every race! Good sign, actually. Means he's stoked!
JAMES continues vomiting...
There's a lie that all drivers tell themselves. "Death is something that happens to other people." That's how you find the courage to get in the car in the first place...
JAMES emerges, wiping his mouth...
All right, Superstar?
Never better, Patron.
Because bad things only happen to others, right?
Have a gargle with this.
JAMES takes a quick swig of the champagne...gargles, then swallows, puts on his balaclava...
Problem is deep down you know that's a lie. That it could happen to you at any moment.
Quick toke of this...
HESKETH passes over a joint, which JAMES inhales, taking huge lungful from....
So how do you make that terror go away? Well, booze is good for that. And wacky baccy. But better than everything else is...sex.
JAMES goes to the NURSE...and kisses her full on the lips then puts on his helmet, and athletically vaults into the JAMES hits the ignition, and a deafening high-pitched SCR as the engine starts...

Ahhhh! What music! They could never have predicted it, those pioneers that invented the automobile that it would possess us like this, in our imaginations, our dreams. Nursie, men love women...but even more than that, men love CARS...
JAMES notices another driver (NIKI LAUDA), his car alread unloaded, (number 35) and mechanics working on it..
Who's that?
He's new. Some German.
(corrects) Austrian.
Is there a difference?
JAMES looks over. On the side of the car, painted marking the form of a signature, "Niki Lauda".
All bloody Goosesteppers.

JAMES is neck and neck with NIKI. They go into a corner. NIKI gets there first. Up ahead though, approaching the s bend...JAMES sees the tiniest, slimmest crack to overtake right-minded driver would risk it. Only a suicidal maniac Which just happens to describe JAMES perfectly.. JAMES goes for it. Daringly. Brilliantly. And forces NIKI slam on his brakes to prevent a certain crash...
HESKETH, BUBBLES, DOC and the NURSE watch from the sidelines...
That move was suicide!
It was also quite brilliant!! God he's got balls!!

JAMES carries on driving. Flat out. But on the flat, NIKI suddenly comes out of nowhere. As i car has 50 bhp more. And overtakes JAMES. NIKI begins to pull away. And has th Englishman beaten.. JAMES sees red mist...and in an act of do-or-die vengeful madness, JAMES goes into a corner far too fast... ...yanks his steering wheel. And outrageously shunts NIKI car. An unforgivable act of unsportsmanlike vindictivenes NIKI and JAMES's cars both veer off...go into wild, letha spins..but luckily for JAMES he ends up facing the right way...

...and despite being badly shaken, dizzy, JAMES is able t change gears, and continue driving... NIKI's car, by contrast, has stalled...and now ends up fa THE WRONG WAY on the track... NIKI's eyes look up to see all the cars coming over a bro like a herd of Wildebeest, heading towards him...
Umgotteswillen...

NIKI rips open his seat-belt, is about to get out of his when one car shoots straight over the nose of his car. NIKI ducks, then bravely leaps for cover, as.... "SMASH", one of the oncoming cars shunts into his car, (i would have killed him instantly). "WHAM", another car narrowly misses him... "CRASH", another car forces NIKI into an evasive dive... Cars scream past him on all sides as the race continues.. NIKI, battered, shaken, has had an unbelievably close esc He rips off his helmet, furious... And now we see NIKI LAUDA's face for the first time. Shar featured. Intelligent eyes. Dark hair. Protruding teeth. Something unmistakably rat-like about him.

JAMES is on the podium, having won. He's with the NURSE, HESKETH and BUBBLES and his team, spraying them with champagne.. NIKI walks past the podium, holding his blue helmet, and shouts out, still incandescent...
Hey...asshole! That was my line! I had that corner...
You mean the one you spun out of? And finished facing the other way? I think that corner had you.
Laughter.
That move was total suicide. What if I hadn't braked? We'd have crashed..!!
But we didn't, did we? Thanks to your impeccable `survival' instincts...
JAMES makes chicken noises...
Fuck you! What's your name?
James Simon Wallis Hunt. Remember it, my little Jerry friend. Because one day he will be World Champion.
Jawohl. Remember ze name. Very simple. "Hunt". It rhymes with....
"BEEEEP", a car horn hoots nearby, blocking out JAMES's c insult...
...a word that happens to describe you perfectly.
Laughter. NIKI gives JAMES the finger, "Screw you, asshol The NURSE watches NIKI go..
Who was that?
No one. Chippy little Kraut. Bad loser. Forget him.
NIKI continues to walk off, middle finger raised..
To establish: the Austrian capital. OVER THIS: the sound NIKI's voice...
In my home town, Vienna, my family is famous for one thing. Business. My grandfather was a businessman, my father, too...
NIKI is in front of a mirror, and dresses smartly in a ja and open necked shirt, evidently a little nervous...
So when they heard I wanted to race cars for a living, they had a few things to say...
A large, forbidding dining room. NIKI's FATHER and terrif GRANDFATHER, are eating supper. GRANDFATHER shakes his he clearly disapproves and barks in German...(we see subtitl

Never! Racing is for playboys and dilettantes. Frivolous amateurs with nothing in their heads. The name `Lauda' appears on the front pages, with politicians and economists, not on the back pages with... (gestures in contempt)
...footballers and skiers. If you want my money, you do as I say and follow me into my business.. NIKI stares at his GRANDFATHER..
It's in moments like this that you discover who you really are.. ...and in a move that he knows will rupture the family fo ever, NIKI gets to his feet..

Fine. Keep your money. Don't invest in me. But when I'm World Champion, and I have the trophy, and my name is not just on the back pages, but on the front too, you will regret it. NIKI walks out, the old man's insults ringing in his ears
You dare sit at my table and lecture me on what I will or won't regret? Get out! Impertinent wretch! Consider yourself disowned!
NIKI is in a meeting with visibly concerned BANKERS and LAWYERS. They speak in German...
Another loan? Herr Lauda, you still haven't repaid the other...
Three..
Totalling millions of Schillings. Plus your Grandfather called to inform us he will no longer be offering security.
I know. There is no room for failure. I understand that.
But I was still a Lauda...

location: NIKI'S CAR/ ROAD TO VIENNA AIRPORT

text: NIKI is driving his car. Beside him, is the attache case his lap. His car passes under a motorway sign reading "Flughafen". (Airport)...
...which meant I was still a businessman above everything else.
A private jet. A balding, blazered Englishman in late mid age (LOUIS STANLEY), owner of BRM racing, disembarks onto tarmac...
It just so happens that the business I deal in is speed.
NIKI sits with LOUIS STANLEY in an airport cafe. Contracts are open on the table. NIKI is signing. LOUIS STANLEY is counter-signing...
In return for your money you get a car, mechanics and a place on the team. Plus fifty per cent of starting fees and bonuses for podium finishes.
Who's the number one driver?
Clay Regazzoni and you will defer to him at all times.
NIKI takes out his cheque book and pen. He looks up...
Why would I defer to him if I am paying his wages?
NIKI writes the cheque. STANLEY's smile fades..
Because he's a proven winner at the highest level, a good guy, and someone who quite frankly, could teach you a thing or two.
NIKI ignores this, continues scrutinizing the contract...
OK. There is one clause missing.
The one about mechanics' exclusivity? Sorry. We have a cardinal rule at BRM. All information is shared between ALL our drivers..
And I made it perfectly clear that my mechanics work for me. No one else. This is something I cannot sign.
NIKI takes back the cheque. STANLEY stares...
All right. I'll have the lawyers amend it.
While you're at it you can tell them to amend the clause for podium finishes. Podium is first THREE places, not just wins.
NIKI puts the cheque in his attache case. Snaps it shut, taking it with him..
You'll get the money on signature, as agreed. See you at winter testing. NIKI gets to his feet, and leaves. STANLEY watches the at case disappear.
If that little git drives half as well as he negotiates, we're going to be fine.
An awards ceremony is in progress. The room is thick with cigar and cigarette smoke. A presenter on stage, wearing tie...

I'm delighted to say the winner of the British Guild of Motoring Writers award for the `Most Promising Driver of the Year' is James Hunt... A loud, boisterous cheer goes up at the Hesketh Racing ta JAMES turns to a (new/different) girlfriend beside him, g her a lingering kiss on the lips, then gets to his feet, shakes hands with HESKETH, and BUBBLES and skips up to th podium...

Thank you. My parents always wanted me to be a doctor, or stockbroker, and gave me a first class education...but to no avail. My brothers are the success stories. I get bored easily. I have a hot head, an inability to tolerate discipline. I fall out with people left and right. I'm quick to settle matters with my fists. The only creatures I've ever loved and treated well, are budgerigars. In any normal area of life, I'd be...or AM...a total liability. All I've got going for me is I'm quick in a car.
A good-looking woman calls out..
That's not all!
Laughter.

So thank you for acknowledging that. And giving me this... (indicating trophy) I'm going to give it to my Dad, and tell him to put it on the mantle-piece and imagine it's a first class degree in medicine.
Afterwards: everyone is celebrating. Thanks to JAMES, eve pretty woman in the club is around. The trophy is perched beside bottles of champagne...
Well done, Superstar. One more season in F2 then I'll move you up. To the big time.
You don't think I'm ready now?
You are! I'm not! I've got to find you a car first. And the money. The economics of Formula 1 are terrifying.
Hurry up. You don't want him to do what Lauda did.
`Pop', HESKETH opens a bottle of champagne... BUBBLES (contid) The Goosestepper. Remember him?
JAMES makes the chicken noises again..
Said he no longer wanted to risk his life with "a bunch of crazy amateurs and losers..."
Is that what he called us?
Charming!
Nothing wrong with being an amateur!
Said if he was going to risk his life, he would only do so on the big roulette table. Formula 1. So he got himself a drive with BRM.
What? How? He never won a thing! Not a single bloody race.
Amateurs are what made this country great.
Took out a loan, apparently. Paid for it himself.
"In war, as in lovemaking, amateurs are invariably better than professionals." Napoleon Bonaparte.
A hundred and fifty grand!
A hundred and fifty grand?
JAMES stares. Already sick with envy.
That's either an act of utter lunacy, or the ballsiest thing I ever heard.
The PAUL RICARD circuit near Marseilles in the South of France. Where all winter training and testing is done. NIKI arrives. An attractive woman (AGNES) greets him...
Niki Lauda. Here for pre-season testing. BRM?
Take a seat, please. I'll get someone to come and collect you...
NIKI watches as she telephones the BRM workshops...
Hi. There's someone here for you?
(prompting) Lauda.
(misunderstanding, speaking louder) SOMEONE HERE TO SEE YOU.
She hangs up. NIKI decides against pointing out her mista
They'll be right here.
Thank you.
A silence. The RECEPTIONIST continues with her work. NIKI watches her, unsure what to say, (small-talk not his fort
Worked here long?
Excuse me?
Just wondered if you've worked here long?
Almost eight years.
That long? And they didn't promote you yet?
Yes, several times. I am the AGNES. Agnes Bonnet. If you're looking for the receptionist, she's on her lunch.
NIKI is thrown. Feels humiliated. A total jerk. He is abo say something when the door opens, and... Two other F1 DRIVERS walk in..

Glamorous, long-haired, tanned, fashionable - like rock s they talk effortlessly and flirt confidently with AGNES. What are you doing answering the phones? New haircut! Lik What have you done to the weather? They make her laugh. And smile. NIKI feels invisible. Embarrassed. Awkward. Inadequate. H gets to his feet. And goes to the car that has come to co him. As he goes, (unseen by NIKI), AGNES watches him. Ignoring other DRIVERS. Intrigued. He's different. Interesting. Intense. Intelligent eyes.
The car pulls up outside the workshops. NIKI gets out of car, and is greeted by LOUIS STANLEY, and the BRM team...

Niki, let me introduce you to our number 1 driver, Clay Regazzoni..and our number 2, Jean Pierre Beltoise.. The intimidating, muscular, moustachioed figure of CLAY REGAZZONI, the Swiss driver. NIKI and CLAY shake hands.
And these are your mechanics, reporting exclusively to you. As per contract... REGAZZONI, BELTOISE and STANLEY exchange looks as NIKI sh hands, ad-libbed greetings with his MECHANICS.
You want to see the car?
NIKI is led into the workshop to see a red and white Marl sponsored car, number 21, with a tall air-intake duct jus above the driver's helmet...
There she is. The P160..
Same as Regazzoni's?
Identical in every detail.
NIKI scrutinizes the car...
She looks heavy. How much does she weigh?
540 kilos.
That's crazy. Why so heavy..?
It's a 3 litre, V12 engine, that thing weighs 190k alone.
What horsepower are you getting out of it?
Not enough. Needs to be 500 and the engine needs to be 20k lighter.
We already tried...
Did you use magnesium parts?
The MECHANICS look at one another skeptically...

Shooting from above: The entire car has been stripped to a thousand pieces. No spread all over the workshop floor. NIKI's team of mechanics reluctantly work through the nig making the adjustments which NIKI is suggesting...
Any solid plate, strip it out...
More disbelieving, skeptical looks. The car is in pieces the floor. NIKI brews coffee to keep people alert. Focuse
And when we've done that, we need to look at the aerodynamics. Front and rear wing..
More mutinous looks. "Who is this asshole?"
Daylight breaks over the race-track. The doors to the wor open, and the MECHANICS and NIKI emerge - their work done NIKI goes to shake hands with the MECHANICS...
OK. Thank you. Good night..
But they're exhausted. Refuse to shake hands with this nu

LATER: one of the BRM cars screams round the race-track.. NIKI watches on the sidelines as CLAY REGAZZONI is time- testing his car. He walks over to where LOUIS STANLEY and several MECHANICS are doing the timings...
What was his time?
Two minutes six seconds.
OK. Now put him in my car, and he'll go round under two minutes.
Six seconds faster? Impossible.
NIKI looks up to see AGNES, the attractive TRACK MANAGER on the other side of the track. NIKI waves hi. AGNES waves back. Smiles. NIKI raises his eyebrow. Surprised.
REGAZZONI gets into NIKI's car.
REGAZZONI races round the track at full speed. REGAZZONI roars past the finishing line in NIKI's car. LO STANLEY looks at the stop watch.. His expression changes.
STANLEY comes into the workshop where NIKI and his MECHAN are in conversation, getting changed...
All right. What did you do to the car?
That's information I will share with you under certain conditions only. STANLEY stares, bracing himself..
Go on...
A guaranteed place in the team, and a paid contract on equal terms with Regazzoni for two years.
Are you crazy? Clay's a senior figure in Formula One...you're a rookie. The only reason we took you ON was because you were paying us.
Well, as of now, if you want me to stay, we rip up the contract. I don't pay you a cent.
It's outrageous.
Was he quicker in my car? He was, wasn't he? STANLEY stares...
Did he go under two minutes?
(quiet) One fifty-six.
So have a think, work out your priorities, and get back to me.
NIKI turns, and goes. STANLEY stares...
Not even my WIFE speaks to me like that.

CLAY REGAZZONI emerges from testing his car. Still amazed the improved performance. Talking to his MECHANICS. In aw He removes his helmet, then stops. In the distance he sees NIKI talking to AGNES the attract TRACK MANAGER. They are clearly hitting it off..

NIKI is in the showers, then getting changed for his date AGNES. He is about to go, when he stops, and sees... CLAY REGAZZONI getting undressed, looking at NIKI. CLAY s English with an Italian accent..
I know what you're going to say. That it's none of my business...
What?
If it's the Track Manager you're taking on your date tonight?
NIKI immediately becomes defensive...
It's none of your business.
Okay, but if you want my advice...I'd let this one go. I'm not questioning your taste. She's a great girl.

REGAZZONI (contid) But Agnes's last boyfriend was a British Formula 2 driver, who has a reputation for two things. For being a suicidal jerk on the track, and for going all night, and all day afterwards...and all night again in bed. He's an OK driver, but an IMMORTAL fuck, apparently. I don't know about you, but that's not an act I'd like to follow. (shrugs) But if that doesn't bother you...
What's his name? The driver?
Hunt. James Hunt.
NIKI stares. Can hardly believe it.
See? You share information, I share information.
CLAY slaps NIKI on his back, and goes into the showers..
That's what team-mates are for.
(quiet/defeated) Thanks.
A restaurant in Marseilles. Through the window we can see AGNES, the attractive TRACK MANAGER sitting at a table al Waiting for NIKI. Reverse angle to reveal:
NIKI is sitting in a car across the street. He stares at in the restaurant. Then starts his car, and drives off.

Easton Neston. Set in 3,300 acres, one of England's great country houses. Home to the Fermor-Hesketh family since 1 JAMES and a new GIRLFRIEND drive up the gravel drive in h anything but grandiose Mini. It splutters to a stop, just time. They are greeted by uniformed STAFF who take his tatty ba from his filthy car.
The Hesketh Racing workshops, situated in the converted stables on the estate. HESKETH leads a blindfolded JAMES
Keep them closed...! Wait for it, wait for it... HESKETH removes JAMES's blindfold...
There! What do you say? JAMES opens his eyes to see a gorgeous F1 racing car, pla white, no stickers...
Isn't she a beauty? The March 731. Converted by the brilliant Doc..! DOC POSTLETHWAITE takes a modest bow. JAMES shakes hands everyone, including his brother, (and manager), PETER..
She is a beauty. But...haven't you made a mistake?
What?
That's not a Formula 2 car. She's F1.

She is, Superstar. Why? Because I got together with the beancounters, and it turns out that the economics of F1 are not so significantly different to the economics of Formula 2... BUBBLES clears his throat, dutifully bites his tongue..
So we thought if we were going to be messing about losing money we might as well be doing it with the big boys.
Are you serious?
Never been more serious in my life!
JAMES embraces HESKETH in excitement, kisses him...
Actually, I got the idea after what you said about the Austrian chap who bought his way in rather than waste his time in the lower divisions. I thought, "Bloody hell, he's right!"
JAMES slips into the cockpit...
Well done the Goosestepper!!
(indicates car) No sponsorship, Superstar! I hope you approve.
I do, Patron.
No vulgar logos for cigarettes, or condoms. Just plain white. With the Union Jack. And racing overalls which read...
HESKETH indicates JAMES's hanging racing overalls...
"Sex. Breakfast of Champions." Unless it's me, of course, in which case it's two kippers, porridge, boiled eggs, and half a dozen slices of toast...
Laughter.
So when do we start?
Soon as you're ready.
I'm ready now.
That's my boy! HESKETH pops champagne...
They won't know what's hit them!

To establish: a Formula 1 race track on Grand Prix week-e A helicopter comes in to land. The Hesketh Racing Team makes a grand entrance with a ret of BUTLERS, GIRLS, ROLLS' ROYCE's, oysters, champagne... A famous ex-champion TV REPORTER is there (Stirling Moss) providing skeptical commentary about Hesketh's debut...

...hard to tell whether Lord Hesketh and his team of upper class enthusiasts is bringing glamour to the racing community, or just comedy... They walk around in their own branded clothing. Alexander jacket reads, "Le Patron". He speaks to MOSS. Rolled eyes among other racing teams who express surprise curiosity (and frequently disapproval) at these new arriv

It's certainly the first time I can remember seeing a butler serving caviar and oysters in the pits... Suddenly pandemonium breaks out. Screams. Something has happened. A bad accident on the track. During testing...
(holding ear-piece)

...reports are reaching me of a serious accident that has just taken place in qualifying.... All smiles fade. The party atmosphere changes in a flash. Panic breaks out. The sound of sirens. Ambulances rushing to the scene of t accident. All the JOURNALISTS and TV CREWS rush off, too.
HESKETH, BUBBLES and JAMES look at one another, put down champagne glasses, and follow...

Mangled wreckage. A car has crashed into (badly installed Armco guard rails, splitting the railing in two... The DRIVER has been decapitated. His helmeted HEAD lies cleanly severed on the ground... A goldfish-bowl of blood. It's a horrific accident. People SCREAM and look away. Ev hardened medical professionals... JAMES, HESKETH, BUBBLES arrive on the scene of the accide But they are kept away, at a distance...
...it seems the driver...just twenty- six years old....was killed on impact...and the death toll in Formula 1 shows no sign of slowing down...
JAMES, dressed in his overalls, is violently retching. Si with nerves. A TV plays in the pits...
...in the last five years alone Formula 1 has lost Piers Courage, Jo Siffert, Peter Revson, Jochen Rindt, Francois Cevert, Roger Williamson...
ON TV: quickfire clips of the terrible, violent deaths. BUBBLES hastily switches off the TV as JAMES walks past..
JAMES walks out of the paddock, towards his car. Other DR gathered in concerned groups, talking...
It's terrible.
They should cancel the race.
Then, a distinctive Austrian accent..
Why? No one came to see him anyway. He made a mistake. Went into the corner too fast.
Is that right? So says the nobody who had to pay for his own drive. How's that working out, by the way?
Fine. How's it at the back?
Not planning on being there for long.
Good. Look forward to you showing me the way today.
`Be happy to. I'll have you inside lap one.
Yeah right.
JAMES walks off to his car, shaking his head..
Asshole.
NIKI walks to his car, putting on his helmet.
Asshole.

NIKI is on the podium, spraying champagne. He is wearing victor's garland... Meanwhile: JAMES's car is embarrassingly being brought ba a tow-truck. NIKI watches from the podium.. His eyes meet JAMES's..
JAMES and BUBBLES and PETER HUNT (JAMES's blazer-wearing manager and elder brother), sit together at a table in th corner. It's late. A frank post-mortem. Drinking and talk
Niki humiliated me today. He lapped me three times.
He lapped Carlos Pace six times.
That's supposed to console me? What do I need to do?
Grow up.
Shut up, Moneyman. `Didn't ask you..
Your brother's right. You've got to change your attitude. We all do. And match it with a whole different mental approach. Professionalism. Maturity. Like Niki.
Bet he doesn't go out every night, drink and screw himself stupid.
So speaks the jealous married man..
No. So speaks the manager who's wasting his time, making ten per cent of absolutely nothing.
You've just got to take it more seriously. Yourself more seriously.
Something he's never done.
Don`t patronize me, Pete...
We need you to spend less time in bars and nightclubs...
Make that NO time...
And more time with the mechanics, setting up the car. That's what Lauda does. 24 hours a day.
JAMES rolls his eyes...
God knows there's nothing wrong with your talent. Or courage. It's purely a character issue right now.
And the good news is I've got Sigmund Freud Horsely, failed driver par excellence, and a washed-up accountant to lecture me on it.
(closes eyes) Jesus, James...
BUBBLES walks off. PETER HUNT walks off. JAMES calls out.
Bubbles? I'm sorry..! I didn't mean that! Come back..!
The grand Hesketh estate in the Northamptonshire countrys
JAMES is in the workshops, his hands and arms filthy, he' been working on the car - but now his eyes are closed. Memorizing tracks. Around him people are working on the c
....along the Beau Rivage, long left into Massenet, into the short right of Casino. Sharp right into Mirabeau, then sharp left into Loews, mind the guard rails...
Is Alexander around..? JAMES opens his eyes to see an endless pair of legs, a dr dead gorgeous figure, and the beautiful smiling face of S MILLER, the most successful model of the day.
He was. Then went to the house to take a call. He'll be back shortly.
Only he wanted to show off his pride and joy... SUZY indicates the car...
...rhymes with `boy' if you ask me. And `toy'. I can't believe what I'm seeing.
Why?
It's just so small! For something that costs so much. And so flimsy. There's no comfort. No protection. Nothing.
No. Just a little coffin, surrounded by high-octane fuel, being driven round at 170 miles per hour..
JAMES (contid) (becoming grave) To all intents and purposes a bomb. On wheels.
Why don't they make it safer?

No one wants it to be. It's like saying why not make bullfighting safer? It's a blood sport. The risk of death turns people on. Without it, I guess, it'd be half the fun. Which is fine for the voyeurs, fine for TV, fine for everyone.. (a beat) ...except us drivers.
SUZY looks JAMES up and down. Sees the bare feet, the roc star good looks...
You're James, aren't you?
Yes.
Thought so. You fit the description. (shaking hands) Suzy. Friend of Alex's.
I know exactly.
In the background: one of the MECHANICS shows DOC a pictu SUZY from a tabloid newspaper. She's clearly the most fam model in Britain, and a star in her own right...
What was the description?
Mostly positive in terms of appearance. Negative only in terms of character. I've been told to avoid you.
By whom?
Alex. He says you're a bad boy.
Was. Not any more. New me very professional. Early to bed. Early to rise. All very dull.
Really?
Round-the-clock work, practise and focus. Tedious, but apparently the only way to vin against ze Goosestepper..
Is that what you were doing when you came in?
Visualization techniques. Memorizing the circuit, in this case Monaco, which is next up. Eyes closed, know your way round in your sleep... (a beat)
I know...I've always been a great believer in getting there on the day, putting the old foot down and playing chicken with everyone else. SUZY laughs..
But they don't want me to do that anymore...they want my body like a temple. My mind like Monk.
And your soul? Your heart?
What does that mean?
You can't be so disciplined in all areas of your life, can you..?
They want me to stop messing around, get married and settle down with the next nice girl I meet. They think it would be good for me.
What do you think?
Sounds bloody awful. SUZY laughs again...
But since they're right about most things, they're probably right about that, too. JAMES looks SUZY up and down...
You don't fancy getting married, do you?
The sound of ringing bells. London's grandest Catholic ch in the heart of Knightsbridge..

JAMES and SUZY, top hat and tails, flowing white wedding dress, looking ravishing, emerge from the church. JAMES and SUZY fall into a passionate, sexy embrace for t paparazzi cameras. Loud cheers go up, led by HESKETH and BUBBLES. They make their way to the waiting convoy of cars... On his way: JAMES spots a serious-faced HESKETH and DOC POSTLETHWAITE in conversation with some Formula 1 types i crowd.. SUZY is pulled away for photos. Clearly a bigger star eve than JAMES. JAMES turns to BUBBLES, indicates HESKETH...
What's up?
Nothing. I don't want to ruin your day. BUBBLES stares, then reluctantly...
It seems your revenge against the Goosestepper might have to wait a little longer than you'd hoped. (a beat) He's just been signed by Ferrari.
WHAT??? But that's the best team in the world. They could have ANYONE. Did he pay his way in there, too?
Apparently they took back Regazzoni and he insisted they give Lauda a trial. Thinks he's a genius. Setting up the cars...
JAMES stares...then is pulled away to pose in photographs SUZY and her FAMILY.
FERRARI's state-of-the-art practise facilities and privat test-track in Northern Italy.
Closed circuit television, with 10 cameras and a complex timing system and computers....

ENZO FERRARI himself, the Commendatore, a formidable whit haired patriarch in Onassis dark glasses, reads newspaper sitting by the race tracks, barely looking up as two red Ferrari's roar round the track... LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO, the young, dynamic, aristocratic man of the Scuderia, by contrast, watches eagle-eyed..
The two cars stop, and NIKI and CLAY REGAZZONI gets out. talks (in a mix of Italian and English) to his MECHANIC, giving them typically blunt feedback...
It's terrible! Drives like a pig!
Sssshhh! You can't say that!
Why not?
It's a Ferrari!

I've driven better milk floats. It understeers like crazy and the weight distribution is a disaster... The MECHANIC gulps, then walks over to where the terrifyi COMMENDATORE and LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO are sitting, and pas on the information...
He says the car is magnificent, a masterpiece, but he has suggestions for one or two minor refinements...

A large press conference, with motoring JOURNALISTS and television CREWS from all over the world attending... ENZO FERRARI and LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO addresses the confer (in Italian) which is translated by a translator...
We are happy to welcome back to the Ferrari family our good friend, Clay Regazzoni...and also to introduce, from Austria Niki Lauda.. A burst of flash photography. NIKI and REGAZZONI sit side side.
A car drives fast on country roads in Northern Italy...
CLAY REGAZZONI is driving, NIKI is in the passenger seat.
"Ferrari Family". "Our good friend, Clay Regazzoni".
REGAZZONI (contid) You're friend and family to the Commendatore as long as you win. The minute you don't.. (mimes execution)
I understand. It's business. I would be the same.
But it isn't just business, is it? What we do? It's passion. Love. Which is why we're prepared to risk our lives for it.
Not me. If I thought I had more talent and could earn better money doing something else, I would.
But how do you know you will make money here? You haven't yet.
Not yet. But I will. (smiles) If you can, I can.
REGAZZONI shakes his head, can't help smiling...
You know, are you ever NOT an asshole?
NIKI laughs...
Why am I an asshole? You know by now I'm both quicker than you and better at setting up the car. You can't deal with that, then you're the asshole.
Screw you.

REGAZZONI pulls up outside the house... REGAZZONI (contid) I brought you along today because you seem like a lonely kind of guy. I thought if I introduce you to some nice people, it'd be good for you. Forget it. Make your own friends.
REGAZZONI walks ahead, disappears through the front door, where he is warmly welcomed, and invited into a party. NIKI calls after him...
I'm sorry. C'mon, Clay...

NIKI stares through the window. Inside: a very appealing looking bunch - young, good-looking, cool, sexy GUESTS - having a good time.. By contrast: NIKI catches his own reflection in the glass reflection. Pale. Intense. The outsider. Inside: REGAZZONI is surrounded by friends, telling a sto Everyone laughs. NIKI watches. Then turns to walk away. As he goes, the fr door opens... And a beautiful dark-haired woman (MARLENE) emerges loadi several BAGS into a car. Brunette, tan. Wearing a white d
Are you leaving?
Yes.
Can you give me a lift to the nearest town? Anywhere with a train station.
Sure. Nearest town is half an hour's drive. Get in.
The car drives. The radio plays. Marlene sings along. NIK can't help noticing something. He turns down the music. MARLENE's smile fades..
What are you doing?
You hear that noise when you accelerate?
No.
Your drive belt is loose.
My what?
Alternator. And when you brake, your foot goes all the way down. Means there's air in the system.
Anything else?
No. Apart from the rear brakes are imbalanced. The front right wheel is flat, and it feels like a crack in the engine block...which explains why you're drifting so much.
How can you tell?
My ass.
What?
God gave me an OK mind, but a really good ass, which can feel everything in a car.
You don't know what you're talking about. The car is fine. And it just had a service a week ago.
Not a good one.
A very good one. From a proper garage. It cost a fortune. This car is good as new. Relax.

White smoke pours from the engine. The car has broken dow Bonnet up. NIKI has tried fixing it, but to no avail. NIKI has a fan belt in his hand, but it's all but disintegrated under the heat of the over-worked engine. NIKI's hands are covered in oil. He is pushing a pen into large crack in the engine, slick with oil and grease.
Nothing I can do here. The car needs a garage.
I'm sorry. You're not in a hurry, are you?
No. As long as I'm back in Maranello by Monday morning. NIKI walks out into the road. Sticks out his thumb...
So who are you anyway? MARLENE breaks into GERMAN...(we see sub-titles)...
You're from Vienna, aren't you. We can speak German. How do you know Curd?
Who's Curd?

Curd Jurgens. The actor. It's his house. He is, or was until yesterday, my boyfriend. I must have been mad! There is something very attractive about an older man when they behave like one. But when they behave like a frightened child.. MARLENE gets to her feet...
C'mon, let me do this. Otherwise we'll never get out of here. We're in Italy, after all. MARLENE indicates that NIKI should take a back seat, hitc up her skirt, showing long, tanned legs..
Immediately a passing car screeches to a halt, then rever noisily to pull level. MARLENE smiles at NIKI...
Not bad, eh? Three seconds. Admit it, you're impressed..!
MARLENE smiles flirtatiously at the handsome, young Itali MEN driving the open-topped sports car..
Ciao, Regazzi...!
But the Italian MEN walk right past her, not seeing her, she's invisible, and stare at NIKI...
(in Italian) Excuse me...are you Niki Lauda?
Yes.
(in Italian) Oh, my God...!!! I told you it was him..!!! (blown away) Do you need a ride?
Yes, we do...
The ITALIAN MAN gestures to his car, as his friend loads MARLENE's luggage inside...
An honour, please!!! But on one condition..

The ITALIAN MAN whisper in NIKI's ear. MARLENE stares, no understanding, as NIKI protests, but then slowly, relucta gets into the car. He starts the engine. MARLENE watches as the ITALIAN MEN strap themselves in wi the seat-belts, tightening them...giggling like schoolboy
Will someone please tell me what's going on?
MARLENE turns to NIKI...
Who are you, anyway? What do you DO?
You don't know? He's a Formula I driver. Who just signed for Ferrari!
Him? Never. Impossible!
Why?
Formula 1 drivers have long hair, are sexy, have shirts open to here.. MARLENE indicates...
Anyway, look at the way he's driving!! Like an old man!! It's true. NIKI is driving in the slow lane. Like a pensi

No need to drive fast. It only increases the percentage of risk. We're not in a hurry. No one is paying me. Right now, with zero incentive or reward, why would I drive fast? MARLENE looks at him with her dark green eyes...
(in German)
Because I'm asking you to.
(in German)
And do you always get what you want?
(in German)

Usually. NIKI stares, trying to resist...but cannot. He does a lightning double-declutch... "SLAM", NIKI's foot hits the floor, the engine screams, t rev counter flies to the right... And the open-topped sports car lurches into warp-drive...
MARLENE is thrown back hard in her seat, "Jesus", her eye widen in terror and amazement..

Oh, my God...!! The ITALIAN MEN scream in excitement, holding on for dear as NIKI, his heart not a beat over 60, takes the car to breaking point, in a way it's never been driven before... NIKI overtakes everyone on the motorway, fearlessly weavi between cars at twice their speed.. We CLOSE on NIKI's eyes, remaining dead calm as his passe scream all around him, as he accelerates through the othe cars on the motorway... His EYES remain calm, his WHEELS a blur of speed, and we.
Calm EYES, and WHEELS moving in a blur of speed. We're in middle of a Grand Prix, and NIKI is driving at the limit. CAPTION: "1975". Ahead of him: a familiar sight. The back of JAMES HUNT's Hesketh..

MARLENE watches on TV in the pits as NIKI is engaged in a epic tussle with JAMES... Commentators note the improvement in JAMES's technique, maturity and performance. But then, "Puff", a plume of sm comes out of JAMES's engine. The engine has blown... Immediately JAMES loses speed, and NIKI sails past, overt effortlessly. Taking the chequered flag. Television commentary in various languages tells us: NIKI LAUDA has become world champion...
NIKI's car pulls in, to be mobbed by jubilant MECHANICS a gets out of his car, removing his helmet, embraced by a delighted LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO...
...then falling into a passionate kiss with MARLENE... Champion of the World, he is immediately swallowed up by REPORTERS who are demanding interviews in Italian, German English...

An impromptu party in the paddock area. The victor's garl still round his neck, proudly holding the FIA World Champ trophy, his hair matted with champagne, NIKI passes throu the crowds, accepting everyone's congratulations.. He runs into JAMES, who's in bare feet as usual. MARLENE pulled away to talk to someone else..
Congratulations.
Thank you.
Though with a car like that, the rest of us never stood a chance...
Maybe the fact the car is so good might have something to do with me.
You're still in a Ferrari. And I'm still in a Hesketh. On equal terms, the way it was in Formula 3, I'd beat you, and you know it.
Never. You might get lucky and win one race. Maybe two. Because you're aggressive. But in the long run, over the course of a season, no chance.
Why's that?
Because you're not serious. You're just a party guy. Which is why everyone likes you.
Now try saying that and tell me you're not jealous.
But all that affection, all those smiles is also a sign of their disrespect! They don't fear you. Whereas compare that to me...
Whom no one likes...
Right..
Not even his own team-mates..

Right! Because I'm relentless. I don't screw up. I go to bed early. I look after myself, look after my car. And then, soon as the race is finished, I go home. You should go home more often, too. I heard you got married.
I did.
So where is she?
In New York. Working.
You know I've never seen you with her, once...
NIKI turns to MARLENE, "Let's go"..

JAMES's Mini roars furiously up the long gravel driveway towards Easton Neston. Screeches to a halt. JAMES gets out of the car. Is greeted by staff, whom he uncharacteristically ignores, storming past...
JAMES walks into the workshops where BUBBLES HORSLEY is b doing something...
Right, whatever it takes to beat Lauda, just say it, your word is my command. I'll do it. There are no lengths to which I will not go. And I mean it this time...
JAMES stops, noticing BUBBLES's expression...
What's the matter?
Then JAMES notices what BUBBLES is doing. He's packing.
What are you doing?
Then JAMES notices the lack of activity in the workshops. of the usual mechanics, or engineers..
Where is everyone?
BUBBLES looks up. Unsure how to break it to him.
An old drawing-room. The open fire roars. But HESKETH is uncharacteristically quiet. Defeated..
Do you know what the date is today?
November 14th.
Do you have any idea of the significance of that date?
I'm assuming it refers to some animal you are allowed or no longer allowed to slaughter on your estate.
Actually it's the deadline for securing sponsorship for the forthcoming Formula 1 season. (a beat) Which elapsed at midnight last night. And we didn't attract any.
So? We aren't looking for sponsorship. Condoms and cigarettes. Vulgar, right?
Right. Except we are. Or were. I've made something of a miscalculation. The economics. Formula 1. Reality thereof. Turns out not like the lower divisions at all.
What are you saying?

I'm saying it's over, Superstar. The banks have stepped in. Read me the riot act. Started laying everyone off. Probably have to sell this place. Fun while it lasted, would do it all again and all that... (ashen) I daren't tell you the actual figures.
JAMES stares at a devastated HESKETH...
Christ.
JAMES is on the phone to his brother PETER, while playing Scale-electrix cars on a track alone, barefoot...
I need a drive, Pete. Need you to find me a drive. (listens) What does that mean? "My reputation precedes me?"
"Crash", the electric toy car crashes...
(listens) Really? Is that what they said? (a beat) Did they at least say a "Quick arsehole?" (listens) Bollocks to Lotus. Find me someone else. I'll go mad otherwise.
"Click", JAMES hangs up. SUZY walks in. Sees his mood..
Don't worry. Something will turn up.
JAMES opens a bottle of Scotch, pours himself a drink...
But I doubt that will help in the meantime.
JAMES knocks back the drink...
Why don't we go away for the week-end? Before I leave again for New York?
JAMES carries on drinking..
Talk to me, James. Don't make a stranger of me.
JAMES doesn't react...
I can't watch this.
SUZY picks up her coat, and bag..
What were you hoping for? A well- adjusted knight in shining armour?
No danger of that....
Let me give you some advice.
I'm all ears...
Don't go to men who are willing to kill themselves driving in circles looking for normality.
Well, I certainly didn't get that...
Should have gone for one of my brothers.
There goes that self-pity again. How striking it is -
What's that? Tell me..
The gulf between appearance and reality. Look at you, all sunshine blonde beauty and smiles...yet the reality is...a frightened, immature, depressed, self-pitying child...
At least there's SOMETHING behind the facade.
With a nasty temper..
Fuck off to New York, dear. There must be a moisturizer or eye shadow somewhere that needs your vapid mush to flog it.
How quickly beauty can turn ugly.
Agreed. Repellent. SUZY stares...and goes. JAMES carries on drinking.
The following morning. The phone rings. Piercing the dark JAMES, clearly the worse for wear, is talking to his belo budgies...
Good girl... A surprising vulnerability, and childlike innocence about JAMES. He strokes the birds with real tenderness.. The phone continues ringing. JAMES picks it up...
Hello?
JAMES listens, then hears something on the phone that mak him sit up...
Who? McLaren?
JAMES is waking rapidly now..
Just get me in a room with them, Pete. Say anything. Today? Yes, I can do today. (checks watch) I can be there in an hour.
JAMES starts scribbling down the address.

The headquarters of McLaren Racing in Colnbrook, Bucks. A small, unassuming building on the Poyle Trading Estate. brickwork surrounds a brash yellow facade, with the words `MCLAREN RACING' in large white letters.

A large boardroom. Team Director TEDDY MAYER (American, f Pennsylvania, short, lawyerly, 50's - hair turning grey) at the head of the table. Next to him is Aussie Marlboro spokesman JOHN HOGAN and McLaren Team Manager and chief mechanic ALASTAIR CALDWELL The atmosphere is tense, uncomfortable...
I'll come straight to the point. Our esteemed lead driver...
Fitti-fucking-paldi..
Has ditched us for another team at the last minute..
In November. Fucking outrageous.
And we need a replacement. Asap. Thankfully a few hands have already gone up. Good people...
Like Jackie Ickx.
I'm quicker than Jackie.
But he's consistent, dependable. Sponsor friendly. He'll dress up nice. Say the right things.
What do you want? A driver or a brushes salesman?
We want to be successful.
So do I. But I measure that in podium finishes and beating Niki Lauda not being a show pony for sponsors.
I've heard about this thing with Lauda.
(rolls eyes) Everyone has..
You really think you can beat him? He's World Champion.
I beat him in Formula 3.
This season alone he's had eight podiums, five wins, you've had what?
One.
Only because I've been in the wrong car. I beat him when the playing field was level. I'd beat him again in a McLaren.
JAMES (contid)
It's the only car out there as good as the Ferrari. Which is why I'm here, begging. JAMES stares imploringly..
I'll do whatever you ask. Even put on a suit, talk to sponsors and say the right thing. I promise. (a beat)
Just give me the drive... CALDWELL, HOGAN and MAYER look at one another...
Various shots, to establish. South Africa in the aparthei era. We notice black race FANS unable to get into the tra
...welcome to the Kyalami Racetrack where the big news is..
Crowds flood to the spectator stands. The pit lane stretc into the distance, filled with cars, drivers and mechanic

...that Britain's James Hunt in his first race for Mclaren has qualified fastest, beating Niki Lauda's Ferrari to pole by two hundredths of a second. In the crowds to watch the race none other than movie stars Richard Burton and Liz Taylor... We pick out RICHARD BURTON and LIZ TAYLOR waving to screa FANS.
NIKI and JAMES's cars lined up in positions 1 and 2 on th starting grid. JAMES proudly indicates to NIKI...
New car.
I noticed. JAMES
Pole position. NIKI
I noticed that, too. JAMES
Level playing field now, my ratty little friend. NIKI
Let's see where we are at the end of lap one. NIKI calls after JAMES as he walks to his car... NIKI
Let's see where we are in six races time!! JAMES turns, makes a ratty face at NIKI. Protruding teeth
RICHARD BURTON and LIZ TAYLOR are shown into the VIP area the paddock. They take their seats. LIZ TAYLOR (bored already)
Will this take very long? An OFFICIAL introduces BURTON to various people - among t SUZY HUNT... OFFICIAL
Richard Burton...Suzy Miller, also known as Mrs. James Hunt.
Who? There it is. The deep, dark, sonorous Welsh baritone voice...scarred by alcohol and cigarettes...
James Hunt. One of the racers.
Forgive me. Richard. (extending hand) Also known as Mr. Elizabeth Taylor.
He indicates LIZ who is deeply bored..
What does a girl have to do to get a drink around here?
SUZY smiles. Their eyes meet. And no eyes are more beauti than SUZY's. An immediate connection between them. Their hands hold a fraction too long as they shake...
NIKI's car roars past the finishing line first. JAMES clo behind...
JAMES and NIKI are on the podium together...
My car wasn't right today. Next time I'll have you..
Yeah, yeah...
JAMES's car takes the chequered flag, finishing first!!!
In the pits: TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL and JOHN HOGA leap to their feet in delight. Punching the air. Victory.
Afterwards: JAMES and NIKI are on the podium together... JAMES

What did I tell you? Car fixed. Equal terms. You'd better get used to this. JAMES walks off, to celebrate with the McLaren team... NIKI stares darkly - threatened - watching JAMES go.. ...then goes to talk to LUCA DE MONTEZEMOLO and the FERRA team. CAPTION: "...BUT IS THEN DISQUALIFIED".

head_text.subj: EXT. SPANISH GP PADDOCK/ PARC FERME- DAY

text: A huge furore as several OFFICIALS and FERRARI TEAM MEMBE and TV CREWS surround JAMES's car... Raised voices debating the width of the car, HUNT furious people almost coming to blows... OFFICIAL
The car is too wide.. JAMES
Five eighths of an inch..! OFFICIAL
Which makes it illegal! If you want to compete, you have to change it. JAMES

What? You can't just `change it'. That means rebuilding the car. Who lodged the complaint? It was Ferrari, wasn't it? The two rival PIT CREWS, (McLaren and Ferrari), scream ab at one another in Italian and English - a highly charged explosive atmosphere....
NIKI watches from the inside of the FERRARI TRAILER.
The McLaren MECHANICS, supervised by Alastair Caldwell, a making adjustments to the car to make it `legal'..
...we have to move the wing forward. To make it legal...
But that'll have a knock-on effect on the oil coolers.. JAMES watches - already fearing the worst - as the car is stripped down, effectively being rebuilt...
"BANG", JAMES's car shudders violently, the wheels shake the drive shaft snaps...
"BOOM", a loud explosion. A thick plume of black smoke bi from the engine...
No! No! No!
"CRASH" - JAMES spins out...and a tyre bounces along the track...JAMES's car has crashed into a wall...
I can't stand it... The tyre continues bouncing, people diving out of it's pa before the tyre finally smashes into a hot-dog stand...
JAMES storms back into the pits, screaming at MAYER, CALD and the MECHANICS...
What's happened? What have you DONE?? The car's evil! It's undriveable..!

Later: the victorious NIKI, wearing the garland, is all smiles, giving `winner' interviews, surrounded by MARLENE a delighted LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO. JAMES is also giving interviews, but in a total fury. Vibrating with anger. Still complaining about the disqualification. Complaining about a conspiracy. Complai NIKI finishes talking to JOURNALISTS, and walks off, thro crowds, and bumps into JAMES..
So...six races in. How's it going so far?
Fine! Just got a little problem with a bad loser rat and his team of Italian saboteurs who've destroyed my car.
What are you talking about?
I won that race in Spain. And you know it.
In an illegal car.
The aerofoil was five eighths of an inch too long!! Something that doesn't have the slightest effect on car speed. You complained. Now we've had to totally rebuild the car and it's become a monster.
At least it's a LEGAL monster.
A car that was beating you week in week out, so you have to resort to this. Cheating.

He drives in an illegal car and he calls ME the cheat? Let me tell you: two weeks before that race in Spain, we put 20-inch rims on the rear wheels. We get an extra half second speed on each lap!! But the Old Man tells me we can't use those rims, they make the car too wide. Against the rules. So we go back to 19-inch rims making the car slower again. Rules are rules. For all of us. You're just a bad loser who can't accept that. (tapping head, to MARLENE)
Komm, he's crazy. Sick in the head. NIKI turns to MARLENE, speaks in German...
Den Trottel lassen wir alleine.. (Let's go. Leave this jerk alone.)
No wonder she left him... NIKI and MARLENE go. JAMES is left staring. Not understan
JAMES walks into the crowded MCLAREN pits. Sees TEDDY MAY and ALASTAIR CALDWELL...
Is there something I should know about Suzy? Where is she? Wasn't she supposed to be here today? CALDWELL nervously indicates the Sunday newspapers...
We kept it from you. Didn't want to tell you before the race... JAMES looks at the newspapers, then his expression change
Lurid headlines about SUZY HUNT in New York with RICHARD BURTON. Pictures all over the front pages of RICHARD BURT ELIZABETH TAYLOR, SUZY and JAMES. JAMES's face falls..
Jesus.
A jumbo jet roars down the runway and takes off...
The unmistakable skyline. Among the ten thousand craggy rooftops and skyscrapers... A grand, five-star hotel overlooking Central Park in Manhattan's mid-town district...

A huge collection of paparazzi SNAPPERS and Journalist HA is camped outside the hotel. Immediately a surge of activity, "Here he is"... A burst of flashlights and a volley of questions from the JOURNALISTS as JAMES - gets out of the taxi and runs the gauntlet of humiliation... ...into the hotel..
A large hotel suite. There are flowers everywhere. Newspa are all over the table. JAMES sits opposite SUZY. He sees an expensive gift; rece opened. A diamond necklace..
That from him? SUZY nods. Even the uninitiated eye can tell: it's worth fortune.
Why have you come here, James?
To get you back.

You don't want me back...you never wanted to be married in the first place. You did it because you hoped it might change you...settle you down... help with the racing. Not because you loved me. And who knows, if it had been just the drinking, or the dope, or the infidelity, or the moods...it might even have worked...but when it's all of them?
I know. I'm terrible.
No, you're not terrible. You're just...who you are...at this point in your life. And God help anyone that wants more.
Will he be able to give you more? He has quite the bad boy reputation himself.
What's important is how it feels to me. And it feels like he adores me. A flicker behind JAMES's eyes. Failure.
Right.

He's aware of the delicacy of the situation, and how it looks. Having raided your larder. Plundered your safe. Smash and grab, and so forth. So he's assured me he'll take care of the financial side. And will be very generous. JAMES manages a brave smile.
Fine. I'll give him a call.
SUZY
No. His lawyers will contact you. JAMES notices the vast unmade bed. Where, until recently, people had slept.
JAMES emerges from the hotel - into the storm of paparazz again. He manages a brave smile... JAMES
It's all very amicable. My wife has found herself a new backer...I mean lover...which makes her happy.. (laughter)
Mr. Burton has found a way of feeling young again...let's hope his pockets are deep...they'll need to be... (laughter)

And I've found a way to be single again without it costing me a penny, which has to go down as the biggest win of my career. Laughter from the JOURNALISTS who are hungrily writing do the copy. But JAMES's hollow smile fools no one...

JAMES sits alone in the first class section. A loser on t track, and a loser in love, too. Being played out in the glare of publicity. On the front pages. Being read by eve on the plane. A STEWARDESS looks over, catches his eye. Smiles.

JAMES and the STEWARDESS fucking. Hard. Nothing to do with pleasure. An analgesic - a way of bloc out the pain. JAMES catches his own reflection in the mir Teeth clenched. Eyes burning with anger and self-loathing OVER THIS: we fade in the ROAR of car engines...
JAMES's teeth still clenched. Eyes still burning with ang Driving flat out. At the limit.

Suzy's words still ringing in his ears. Make that beyond the limit. At the point of no return. Th shaking. Weaving recklessly through other cars... Where death has become a real option. Because he doesn't care anymore. Because it's all he dese anyway... And in that moment, in reaching his lowest point, JAMES h unwittingly stumbled on the one thing that gives him an advantage over everyone else... The fact that he doesn't care. The fact that death has be an option. The fact that there is no risk he is not prepa to take... So every corner is tighter, every braking point later, ev gap is an opening, no matter how tiny...
The chequered flag waves as JAMES's car roars across the finish line... JAMES screams with released rage.... CAPTION: "RACE 7. HUNT WINS. LAUDA's ENGINE BLOWS UP"
Afterwards: TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL and JOHN HOGAN celebrate in delight...cheering...

NIKI's car is pursued by JAMES's. They disappear behind a copse of trees. Out of sight. When they re-emerge, JAMES is ahead of NIKI, having overt him - to the delight of the partisan crowd. The chequered flag waves again as JAMES's car roars acros finish line... CAPTION: "RACE 8. HUNT WINS. LAUDA 2nd." JAMES screams in catharsis and triumph. Teeth clenched. E wide and staring with concentration.
We notice SCREAMING GIRL FANS cheering him now.
A blazer-wearing FIA OFFICIAL addresses a room full of sp and motoring JOURNALISTS, TV CREWS, etc...

Following an inquiry into the disqualification of driver James Hunt from the Spanish Grand Prix, it has been decided to overturn this disqualification...and to restore his victory, and reinstate his points..
JAMES, TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL, and all the MECHAN are watching on TV... Huge celebrations. Cheering and whooping. SCREAMING GIRLS
A crowded PRESS room. In opposite corners of the room, JA and NIKI are giving interviews to different PRESS and TV journalists. Stirling Moss is talking to JAMES...

...James, a few weeks ago, you were out of the running for this season completely, now you're right back in it. What's changed...? Screaming GIRLS in the background, shouting "James, we lo you." JAMES stares across the room at NIKI...

A combination of factors, not all of which I'm prepared to discuss here. Justice being done re: the disqualification in Spain helps, and having my old car back of course... In the other corner: NIKI is doing his interviews in Germ (we see sub-titles)...
Mathematically in theory it's now possible for Hunt to catch you. Are you worried?
Not at all. For him to catch me, he'd have to win all the remaining races, and I'd have to lose them. And pigs would have to fly. Laughter among the confident GERMANS.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have a private family matter to attend to. NIKI takes MARLENE's hand, and leads her away.
To establish: the Viennese skyline.
NIKI and MARLENE get married. In stark contrast to JAMES' wedding...it's a small, intimate affair. Modest. Not show Away from the cameras. Just them. And a witness from the
A small aeroplane takes off...

NIKI and an INSTRUCTOR are in the plane. In the cockpit. MARLENE, who watches... NIKI is learning to fly. MARLENE watches as NIKI soaks up the instruction, asking questions, happy. It's another side to him, completely.
NIKI and MARLENE in a pool. In Ibiza. Playing. Laughing. Honeymooning. Then NIKI's expression changes. His smile fades.
MARLENE is fast asleep. She wakes, to discover the bed is empty beside her..
MARLENE walks through the house, looking for NIKI. Then f him on a balcony...alone.. MARLENE
Come to bed. MARLENE notices his mood. It's different. MARLENE
What's the matter? NIKI
It's the enemy, you know. Happiness. NIKI looks up at MARLENE... NIKI
It weakens you. Puts doubt in your mind. Because all of a sudden you have something to lose.. MARLENE stares at him. MARLENE
When you call happiness an enemy, then it's too late. (a beat)
Then you have lost already. MARLENE turns, and goes.. NIKI is left alone. We can tell from his expression, he i struggling with something for the first time. Fear.
The notoriously difficult and treacherous German race tra Testing is underway. A CAR (from one of the other teams) skids, and crashes violently.
AMBULANCES arrive. The Driver is badly hurt. Screaming in pain. His leg is crushed. Bone is sticking out. A brutal compound fracture. He is taken away.
In the pits, everyone is shaken. JAMES, REGAZZONI, and ot DRIVERS nervously talk among themselves as the Ambulance past. NIKI's face: visibly pale. More frightened than ever.
Race-day. Huge crowds arrive at the Nurburgring. And rain Heavy rain falling. Television commentary informs us about the Nurburgring's terrible reputation as a `graveyard' track.
JAMES arrives at the race track, to find ALASTAIR CALDWEL waiting for him, a concerned look on his face... CALDWELL
We've just been told, a driver's meeting has been called. JAMES
Who by? CALDWELL
Niki. JAMES's face. Instantly suspicious.

About sixty people, (26 DRIVERS and all the different tea REPRESENTATIVES), are assembled in the room, where a blaz FIA OFFICIAL and a member of the DRIVERS SAFETY COMMITTEE sitting behind a table... A buzz of anticipation and curiosity. What's going on? Wh all this about? NIKI gets to his feet, raises his hands calling for silence...

Thank you. I called this meeting because as all drivers know the Nurburgring is a race track from the Stone Ages. The most stupid, barbaric, outdated, dangerous, track in the world. You've all seen the rain which has been falling this morning. Those of you with experience know the Ring needs perfect conditions to be even remotely acceptable in terms of risk. As you can see today is anything BUT perfect, so I called this meeting to take a vote to cancel the race. A ripple of astonished reactions among the drivers..
There would be no change to the situation as far as points is concerned. The race would simply be cancelled. TEDDY MAYER looks over at FERRARI representatives....
This is bullshit... Another DRIVER (GUY EDWARDS) gets to his feet...
If the race is cancelled, none of us get our race fees...
It's true. You leave without your fee, but you might leave with your LIFE. Another voice pierces the controversy...
It also means you would effectively win the championship. It's JAMES HUNT, who is standing up...
So I can see why this suits you just fine.
Why? There would be no points for me either...
JAMES
But there would be one race less where I, or anyone else, could catch you. Uproar in the room... BRETT LUNGER
James is right! This is just tactics! ARTURO MERZARIO
Ferrari's dirty tricks! We've seen it before! HARALD ERTL
Maybe it's just that he's frightened? Laughter among the DRIVERS... NIKI
Which asshole said this? Silence. No hand goes up. No one has the courage to own u NIKI

Yes, I am frightened. Always a little bit when I race. I accept every time I get in my car there is 20% chance that I could die. But not one per cent more. And today, with the rain the risk IS more. How dare you accuse me of lack of courage? Let me remind you. I have the track record here. I am the only person in history to do the Ring in under 7 minutes. So actually it's to my ADVANTAGE to race here today. Because I'm quicker than all of you. A stunned silence. One voice pierces the room... JAMES
Fine. Then let's race! It's JAMES who stares at NIKI: a ripple of excitement and enthusiasm among the other drivers... JAMES
There's a hundred thousand fans out there who would never forgive us if we didn't. MERZARIO
And some of us need our race fees!!
FIA OFFICIAL
All those in favour of cancelling the race? NIKI puts his hand up. One or two other racers, too... FIA OFFICIAL
All those in favour of racing? JAMES puts his hand up. Clearly the more popular, charism figure among the DRIVERS, everyone else follows. FIA OFFICIAL

Gentlemen, start your engines!! A clear victory for JAMES. He has swung the room. Everyone leaves the room. JAMES and TEDDY MAYER give one another a discreet hi-five... But we rack focus through the crowd to see NIKI staring a JAMES accusingly...holding his gaze.

"RRRROAAAR", an explosion of noise, as we widen and find ourselves on the starting grid of the German Grand Prix. An OFFICIAL walks through the cars holding aloft a sign, Minute"... Deafening, angry thunder, as cars rev their engines.
A pupil dilates and contracts in the light. The eye stare Blinks. Thinks. Making evaluations..

This time the eye belongs to JAMES. He stares up at the clouds. His eyelids flicker. Thinking. Agonizing. Wrestling with all important decision... Is it going to carry on raining? Or become dry? ALASTAIR CALDWELL comes up to JAMES, and shouts above the noise - no time to plug his headset in...

Jochen's going on slicks. You want to change? JAMES looks in his wing-mirror back to his colleague, JOC MASS's car, number 12, several rows behind him. White helmet. A team of Mclaren MECHANICS hastily changin tyres to bald, dry tyres - ('slicks'). Then JAMES looks o at the car beside him...
Has Niki changed?
No. He's going on wets. NIKI's car: surrounded by Italian Ferrari MECHANICS.

Then we go on wets, too. JAMES pulls down his visor...as he and NIKI's eyes meet f split-second, then... The STARTER waves the flag. They're off! JAMES's foot hits the floor - his engine screams at almos 9,000 rpms, drowning out the roar of the 180,000 crowd. T car is catapaulted forward, the wheel-spin leaving livid scars on the asphalt.. JAMES and NIKI both make good starts, and are neck and ne but within seconds there's a McLaren right behind them, gaining fast. JAMES realizes it's his team-mate, JOCHEN MASS in a white helmet. Number 12. On his slick tyres. MASS was right to gamble on the track drying out. JAMES c under his breath...
Shit...! JAMES screwed up. Made the wrong decision. He urgently ne to change tyres. With barely one lap completed... He swerves angrily into the pits..

Commentary from all the world's TV stations explaining th crazy, panicked situation as JAMES comes into the pits to change to dry tyres. The McLaren team frantically changes the tyres. Four men air guns, two men with rapid-duty jacks. ALASTAIR CALDWELL appears, talks to JAMES.. CALDWELL
See? I told you to go on slicks!! You didn't take my advice... JAMES
Shut up! Where's Niki? CALDWELL

Behind you! He made the same mistake! JAMES looks in his mirror to see NIKI's red helmet behind in the pits, then... "Thump", new (slick) tyres hit the tarmac. JAMES gets the signal, `Clear!' CALDWELL
Go! Go!! Go!! JAMES's foot hits the floor. He roars out, with new tyres leaving NIKI behind him in the pits...
Archive commentary: from the world's TV stations informs that JAMES roars up into 3rd position..

JAMES gives it everything he's got. Tearing through the g breaking as late as he can, engine screaming. The world flies past in a blur. The steering wheel shakes car cannot be driven any harder. No thought for safety. N thought of failure.. Failure is unimaginable. Unconscionable. He turns into the final straight, then stops when he sees something ahead.
Flags. Red flags. RACE MARSHALLS. Something has clearly happened. An accident.. The race is being stopped. JAMES brakes, slowing down. He pulls level with a uniformed MARSHALL..
What's up?
Accident. Bad one.
Who?
We don't know yet.
NIKI's POV: a continuation of the opening scene. Burning fills NIKI's helmet, burning his lungs. He cries out in a

We can just make out the barely recognizable figures of t other DRIVERS rushing towards him, as their hands get bur the flames as they try unsuccessfully to undo his seatbel We notice it is the same DRIVERS that were critical of NI the driver's meeting. HARALD ERTL, BRETT LUNGER, ARTURO MERZARIO, GUY EDWARDS... Fire extinguishers blast at the car. Covering NIKI's helm Filling his lungs with chemicals, along with the smoke an fumes, blurring his vision, as he screams horribly.. The sound of panicked TV COMMENTARY in different language Screaming voices. Panicked reactions. Then sound fades. As NIKI blacks out - losing consciousne
OVER THIS: the hypnotic sound of helicopter blades...
August 1st, 1976, I discovered comas exist for a reason.

NIKI's POV: the door to a helicopter opens, as it arrives Mannheim University Hospital... The sound of shouting voices. Hospital STAFF pull reach towards NIKI, pull his stretcher out. NIKI's internal voice groans: cries out at the pain. NIKI (V/O)
Some things are better not remembered.

"Crash", doors burst open and NIKI is rushed into emergen Neon ceiling lights pass overhead... The sound of difficult breathing. His stretcher is surrounded by DOCTORS, talking urgently, making quick assessments.. NIKI's POV: fading in and out of consciousness. Bursts of concerned, urgent, overlapping dialogue among t German DOCTORS which NIKI can barely make out..
Two narrow, barely open slits of light. NIKI's swollen ey lids. NIKI's POV: barely making out MARLENE standing besi the senior burns specialist DOCTOR. NIKI hears voices... DOCTOR
It's not the burns to his face that are the danger. It's the burns to his lungs. His blood oxygen level is currently... NURSE
DOCTOR
Which is not enough to maintain life... NIKI slips out of consciousness again. MARLENE is distrau in tears.
TV news: giving the latest information on NIKI's conditio

JAMES sits watching the news on TV in his apartment, whil feeding his budgerigars, (the collection has grown).. He feels terrible. He goes to his desk, pulls out paper a pen... JAMES tries to find the right words, tries to write, trie put his feelings on paper, but words in general, and lett in particular have never been his thing...
